qa_pairs.question: How did Binny Bansal's role at Flipkart evolve from his co-founding the company to the Walmart acquisition, and what was his position post-acquisition?
qa_pairs.answer: <statement>Binny Bansal co-founded Flipkart in 2007 and initially served as the chief operating officer (COO) until January 2016, when he was promoted to chief executive officer (CEO).<cite>[S3][S4]</cite></statement> <statement>In January 2017, he was promoted to group CEO, a role he held until November 2018 when he resigned due to personal misconduct allegations.<cite>[S5]</cite></statement> <statement>Following Walmart's acquisition of a 77% stake in Flipkart in 2018, Bansal assumed the position of chairman and continued as Group CEO.<cite>[S28]</cite></statement> <statement>After resigning from Flipkart in 2018, he later fully divested his stake in the company in 2024, marking the end of his formal role in the organization.<cite>[S32]</cite></statement>

Passage 1:
[S1] Binny Bansal


# Binny Bansal



**Binny Bansal** (born 1982/1983) is an Indian billionaire Internet entrepreneur. [S2] As of February 2024, his net worth was estimated at US$1.4 billion. [S3] In 2007 he co-founded the e-commerce platform Flipkart. [S4] He was the chief operating officer until January 2016, when he was promoted to chief executive officer (CEO). [S5] In January 2017 he was promoted to group CEO, then resigned in November 2018 due to personal misconduct allegations of Flipkart. [S6] He is an anchor investor in the venture firm 021 Capital. [S7] In 2019, Bansal invested in the endowment fund of the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Delhi. [S8] ## Early life

Binny Bansal was born around 1982/1983. [S9] His father was a chief manager at a bank and his mother is in the government sector. [S10] He is originally from Chandigarh, the capital city of Punjab and Haryana. [S11] He was educated at St. [S12] Anne's Convent School, Chandigarh. [S13] He studied software programming at IIT Delhi. [S14] He graduated from the Indian Institute of Technology Delhi with a degree in computer science and engineering. [S15] ## Career


### Amazon

After college, he worked at Sarnoff Corporation, and then in January 2007 he joined Amazon as a software engineer. [S16] Early in his career, Binny was employed by Amazon for nine months, and before that, he had been rejected by Google twice. [S17] he quit Amazon to co-found Flipkart. [S18] ### Founding Flipkart

In 2007 he co-founded the e-commerce platform Flipkart. [S19] His business partner, Sachin Bansal, unrelated, also came from Chandigarh, and had been a fellow student at IIT Delhi, studying computer science engineering. [S20] He and his co-founder pooled $6000 for startup costs and started operating out of their apartment. [S21] Before co-founding Flipkart, Binny Bansal and his business partner Sachin Bansal initially thought of starting a comparison search engine but realized that the market for E-commerce in India was very small. [S22] Hence, after leaving Amazon in 2007, they founded Flipkart as an e-commerce company. [S23] Before joining Amazon, Binny had worked with Sarnoff Corporation for a year and a half, where he developed a lane sensor device for cars which would warn you and beep automatically if you changed lanes without giving a signal.ᶜⁱᵗᵃᵗⁱᵒⁿ ⁿᵉᵉᵈᵉᵈ


### CEO of Flipkart

He served as the chief operating officer until 11 January 2016, when he was promoted to chief executive officer (CEO). [S24] In 2016, Binny Bansal became the CEO of Flipkart, where he worked on strategic development, direction and business management. [S25] In 2017, he assumed the role of CEO of Flipkart Group and his previous position was handed to Kalyan Krishnamurthy. [S26] In 2018, Walmart acquired a 77% stake in the Flipkart Group. [S27] After the acquisition, Binny Bansal assumed the role of chairman and continued as Group CEO. [S28] His 5.5% stake in Flipkart was valued at $1 billion after the acquisition. [S29] He resigned from Flipkart in November 2018 on allegations of personal misconduct. [S30] According to the *Wall Street Journal,* a Walmart investigation failed to find evidence to corroborate sexual assault claims against him but revealed "other poor judgement calls" in how he had handled what he termed a consensual affair with a former Flipkart employee in 2016. [S31] Binny Bansal resigned from the executive team on 28 January 2024, and has completely divested his stake. [S32] In the last year, Binny, along with Excel and Tiger Global Management, sold their entire stake to Walmart, resulting in Binny earning $1.5 billion. [S33] Walmart acquired a 77% stake in Flipkart for $16 billion in May 2018. [S34] ### Investing

He is currently an anchor investor in the venture firm 021 Capital which focuses on investing in the fields of biotechnology, agritech, and the internet. [S35] He is also an angel investor in multiple startups, including BrightCHAMPS, Virgio, Flash, Hire Quotient and Glints. [S36] In 2019, he invested 125 crores in the endowment fund of the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Delhi.

Passage 2:
[S37] He also helped back about 47 companies so far spread across 64 funding rounds which include 28 deals in the seed stage, 14 in the early and 4 in late stage. [S38] ## Awards and recognition

In September 2015, Binny Bansal along with Sachin Bansal, was named the 86th richest person in India with a net worth of $1.3 billion by Forbes India Rich List. [S39] Afterwards, *India Today* ranked him #26th along with Sachin Bansal in India's 50 Most powerful people of 2017 list. [S40] ## Personal life

Bansal currently resides in Bangalore. [S41] He has twin sons with his wife Trisha Bansal, a homemaker.
